metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5364 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The (1) udp_recvmsg and (2) udpv6_recvmsg functions in the Linux kernel before 4.0.6 do not properly consider yielding a processor, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (system hang) via incorrect checksums within a UDP packet flood. A flaw was discovered in how the Linux kernel handles invalid UDP checksums. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service using a flood of UDP packets with invalid checksums.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5364` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-58-generic - 3.13.0-58.97
linux-image-3.13.0-58-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-58.97
linux-image-3.13.0-58-lowlatency - 3.13.0-58.97
linux-image-3.13.0-58-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-58.97
linux-image-3.13.0-58-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-58.97
linux-image-3.13.0-58-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-58.97
linux-image-3.13.0-58-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-58.97
linux-image-3.13.0-58-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-58.97
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-58-generic - 3.13.0-58.97
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-44-generic - 3.16.0-44.59~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-58.97').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
